item.title: My script i made wont work
item.dc:creator: @koenradm koenradm
item.description:
@koenradm wrote:

I would also make the wait be random, to do this you would use

Wait(1200+random(2100));

This means that you will wait for a random time between 1200 ms(miliseconds) and 2100ms.

Of course this is only useful if you are repeating your script.

You could also add activateclient; To activate RuneScape. Make shure you have used the crosshairs to select RS first though.

Read full topic
item.source: My script i made wont work

item.title: My script i made wont work
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

But try not to use SendKeys as it will give you a decent ban. Instead, try using keydowns and keyups or have those in a separate procedure to save space, like so:[code=geshi]// --> TrainerScape/Easter guy1’s AutoTalker!
// --> Version 1.0, Please don’t flame. its my first script.
// --> Join Trainerscape.smfforfree4.com To See More Of My Scripts
// --> Release date: Saturday, March 15, 2008
// --> READ INSTRUCTIONS.
//–> this SCAR Script is an auto talker
// --> HOW TO USE SCRIPT: The point is so that it makes mistakes. Where
//–>it says “Good Spelling.” Put how you actually want it spelt. if it says
//–>“Mistake” make a mistake in the typing. that way, people know your
//–>actually typing. (But your not :] ) Example, i was buying full sara, so
//–> I made mistakes.

program script;

const
Message1=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good Spelling.
Message2=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good spelling.
Message3=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; //Mistake.
Message4=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message5=‘Buyin full saar 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message6=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message7=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message8=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.

procedure letter(let: integer);
begin
KeyDown(Let);
Wait(20+Random(21));
KeyUp(Let);
Wait(80+Random(91));
end;

procedure Typing(Text: String);
var
i: Integer;
begin
for i:=1 to length(Text) do
letter(GetKeyCode(Text[i]));
KeyDown(13) //will press enter/return.
Wait(100+Random(51));
KeyUp(13);
end;

procedure Talker;
begin
wait(1000) //1000 = 1 second, 2000 = 2 second, ect.
Typing(Message1); // Tells scar to type the message.
Typing(Message2);
Typing(Message3);
Typing(Message4);
Typing(Message5);
Typing(Message6);
Typing(Message7);
Typing(Message8);
end;

begin
repeat
Talker;
until(false) //Delete the (false) if you want it to repeat it once.
end.[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: My script i made wont work

item.title: My script i made wont work
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[code]// --> TrainerScape/Easter guy1’s AutoTalker!
// --> Version 1.0, Please don’t flame. its my first script.
// --> Join Trainerscape.smfforfree4.com To See More Of My Scripts
// --> Release date: Saturday, March 15, 2008
// --> READ INSTRUCTIONS.
// --> this SCAR Script is an auto talker
// --> HOW TO USE SCRIPT: The point is so that it makes mistakes. Where // -->it says “Good Spelling.” Put how you actually want it spelt. if it says //–>“Mistake” make a mistake in the typing. that way, people know your //–>actually typing. (But your not :] ) Example, i was buying full sara, so
// --> I made mistakes.

program script;

const
Message1=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good Spelling.
Message2=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good spelling.
Message3=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; //Mistake.
Message4=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message5=‘Buyin full saar 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message6=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message7=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message8=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.

procedure Talker;
begin
wait(1000) //1000 = 1 second, 2000 = 2 second, ect.
SendKeys(Message1 + Chr(13)); // Tells scar to type the message.
SendKeys(Message2 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message3 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message4 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message5 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message6 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message7 + Chr(13));
SendKeys(Message8 + Chr(13));
end;

begin
repeat
Talker;
until(false) //Delete the (false) if you want it to repeat it once.
end.[/code]

Make sure your on runescape and it’s focused/active because sendkeys types to wherever your currently at, eg. if you were on msn it’d type in that window, if you were in notepad it would type there, it types wherever is selected

Read full topic

item.title: My script i made wont work
item.dc:creator: @easter_guy1 easter guy1
item.description:
@easter_guy1 wrote:

My script wont work, like it will type it in the debug box or w\e its called. but when i go to my rs2 window it doesnt work. yes i selected the box with the script. yes i pressed ctrl + alt + s. i dont know whats wrong.

[code]// --> TrainerScape/Easter guy1’s AutoTalker!
// --> Version 1.0, Please don’t flame. its my first script.
// --> Join Trainerscape.smfforfree4.com To See More Of My Scripts
// --> Release date: Saturday, March 15, 2008
// --> READ INSTRUCTIONS.
// --> this SCAR Script is an auto talker
// --> HOW TO USE SCRIPT: The point is so that it makes mistakes. Where // -->it says “Good Spelling.” Put how you actually want it spelt. if it says //–>“Mistake” make a mistake in the typing. that way, people know your //–>actually typing. (But your not :] ) Example, i was buying full sara, so
// --> I made mistakes.

program script;

const
Message1=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good Spelling.
Message2=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; //Good spelling.
Message3=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; //Mistake.
Message4=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message5=‘Buyin full saar 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message6=‘Buyign full sara 1.2M’; // Mistake
Message7=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.
Message8=‘Buying full sara 1.2M’; // Good spelling.

procedure Talker;
begin
wait(1000) //1000 = 1 second, 2000 = 2 second, ect.
Writeln(Message1); // Tells scar to type the message.
Writeln(Message2);
Writeln(Message3);
Writeln(Message4);
Writeln(Message5);
Writeln(Message6);
Writeln(Message7);
Writeln(Message8);
end;

begin
repeat
Talker;
until(false) //Delete the (false) if you want it to repeat it once.
end.[/code]

Read full topic
